intro: Dalechampia natalensis, commonly known as Natal dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
